snippet: The confirmation of two new members to the Federal Election Commission, one of the most dysfunctional agencies in Washington, offers a ray of hope.
abstract: Editorial contends Senate's confirmation of Ann Ravel and Lee Goodman to the Federal Election Commission offers a ray of hope; notes commission's work has been stymied for months thanks to a standoff engineered by obstinate Republicans; expresses hope that Ravel and Goodman will breathe new life into the commission and help voters track dark-money campaign manipulation by secret donors.
lead_paragraph: The confirmation of two new members to the Federal Election Commission, one of the most dysfunctional agencies in Washington, offers a ray of hope.

headline.main: New Faces for a Hobbled Commission
headline.print_headline: New Faces for a Hobbled Commission

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
